thread.title: UTD OIT Launches AWS Ready Comets (ARC) Program
thread.title_full: UTD OIT Launches AWS Ready Comets (ARC) Program

author: rkc190002
title: UTD OIT Launches AWS Ready Comets (ARC) Program
text:
By
rkc190002
December 5, 2024 Empowering Students with Cloud Computing Skills The Office of Information Technology (OIT) is thrilled to announce the launch of the first-ever AWS Ready Comets (ARC) Program for the Spring 2025 semester. This initiative aims to empower students with valuable cloud computing skills and industry-recognized certifications, helping them become cloud-ready and capable of empowering their peers. As an ARC associate, students will gain hands-on experience with AWS technologies, prepare for AWS certifications through Coursera, complete capstone projects, and build a professional network with AWS experts and industry professionals. More info about the program can be found here: OIT ARC Program
Program Benefits and Eligibility The ARC Program offers numerous benefits, including up to $50 in AWS credits, Coursera certificates, exclusive invitations to AWS-related events and workshops, mentorship from OIT professionals and AWS experts, and access to official AWS training materials and labs. The program is open to all UTD students, regardless of major or academic level, with no prior cloud computing experience required. Participants should be prepared to commit an average of 5-7 hours per week for the entire Spring 2025 semester.
How to Apply and Important Dates Interested students should submit their applications . Applications open on Dec 16, 2024, and the application deadline is January 5, 2025. The program is set to start on January 21, 2025, with a graduation ceremony in the last week of April or the first week of May.
Donâ€™t miss this exciting opportunity to become an AWS Ready Comet and enhance your career prospects in the rapidly growing field of cloud computing!
Limited seats are available, so apply as soon as possible.
This program is in addition to the existing Microsoft Ambassador program , which opens applications on December 15 for participants in Spring 2025
